We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Wealth Management - Data Analytics Internship/Co-Op - Summer 2023
description:
Requisition ID: 169146

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: May-August 2023

Application Deadline: 01/27/2023

There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Be involved in the definition of business requirements and processes, ensuring that progress can be measured against planned objectives by working with different teams, and internal partners; performing analysis and completing reports to measure project success and impact to business
  • Prepare reports and dashboards to inform strategic decision-making including trending analysis, projections and forecasts utilizing statistical modelling
  • Investigate and become an expert in available data sources of data, transform and determine how they can be interpreted for analysis
  • Flex your analytical skills by identifying and analyzing business and technical requirements to create diagrams, flow charts, and documentation
  • Make impact by constantly identifying and implementing process improvements
  • Experiment & learn!

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
  • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs,
  • You have strong written/verbal communication and project management skills.
  • You have knowledge/experience in:
    • Managing process and planning, facilitating teamwork, and coordinating the execution of multiple deliverables.
    • Interpreting and consolidating large amounts of information in actionable recommendations.
    • Using sound judgment in the creation of analysis, validation, interpretation, and presentation of findings.
    • Cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g., Enterprise Data Warehouse, Unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, SAS, CSV)
    • Visualization tools like PowerBI, Tableau or Qlikview
    • Data Analysis/manipulation tools for working with data (e.g., SQL, DB2, MySQL, Python, R)
    • Making sense of data, creating reports, and communicating KPI’s

What’s in it for you?

  • You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
  • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
  • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.

How do I apply?

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you’re interested in to uncover your true potential. Instead, we ask that as part of your application you complete the below:

  1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
  2. Complete a short one-way video interview here.
  3. Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all three steps above.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior Data Engineering Consultant, TELUS Business Solutions Marketing Analytics
description:
Description

Join our team

Our Team – TELUS Business Solutions Marketing Analytics - has a mandate to build solutions for our stakeholders using data to drive business outcomes. We love to turn data into stories - stories about money falling through the cracks, success stories about our products and services, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience.

Come join our team if you have a passion for data, analytics, and marketing, the courage to innovate, embrace change and embody spirited teamwork to support stakeholders across a wide variety of teams.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

As a Senior Data Engineering Consultant in the team, you will be working with Business Stakeholders and the Data Scientists to build data assets that will be leveraged by the data scientists for machine learning/AI models to protect the customer base, acquire new customers and to enable intelligent marketing campaigns. Your solutions will have a direct impact on marketing sales targets and P&L.

Here\'s how

  • Design and build scalable and resilient Data & Analytics solutions in Google Cloud Platform – architect technical solutions to obtain, process, store and provide insights based on processed data
  • Build data assets for machine learning purposes on Google Cloud Platform
  • Work on automation and optimization of internal processes
  • Provide data analysis and standard reporting support
  • Design, develop, and review data architecture, model, flow, and integration – be hands on and involved with every stage of the ETL pipeline
  • Keep up to date with the evolving Cloud technology and Big Data technology, share the knowledge across the organization by enabling best practices, standards, governed processes and relevant technologies

Qualifications

What you bring

  • Bachelors and/or Master’s degree preferred
  • 5 years of experience in big data analytics and distributed systems
  • Experience in writing code/ETL processes/Monitoring processes in a production ready environment
  • Knowledge of Big Data with a focus on data engineering; optimizing data, pipelines, ETLs
  • Experience implementing production level deployments at an enterprise scale on Google Cloud Platform
  • Strong coding and development skills in programming languages (e.g. Python, PySpark etc.)
  • A Strong understanding of data structures, databases, data lakes, and data ingestion and transformation routines

Great-to-haves

  • Google Cloud Platform Experience
  • Post graduate education in Data, Advanced Analytics, Computer Science Eng/Programming or any other relevant program
  • Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, optimization, and deep learning experience or knowledge
  • Telecom industry experience
  • B2B Experience


#LI-REMOTE

title: Intern, Enterprise Architecture
description:
At CN, everydaybrings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environmentwhere you’re part of making sure ourbusiness is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We welcome students who share theirideas, perspectives and understanding of newtechnologies withour teams. In return, we provide the opportunity towork on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. Youwill be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture workingtogether as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because thework we do matters. Join us!

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern, Enterprise Architecture position in Canada for summer 2023 (May – August).

Job Summary

The Intern, Enterprise Architecture is responsible for supporting emerging technologies and innovation practices. The incumbent researches the latest technology trends applicable to railroading and has the opportunity to communicate trends and innovations to the larger CN I&T community. The role is exposed to the fundamental workings of the railroad across many business disciplines as well as to Research and Development (R&D), architecture, and solution delivery best practices. The position is performed within a team of experienced thought leaders and passionate professionals that solve exciting enterprise challenges in a fun and collaborative atmosphere. The exceptional breadth of exposure to numerous opportunities from “classic” mainframe systems to the bleeding edge of distributed Artificial Intelligence (AI), from telecom to finance and everything in between provides a unique opportunity to understand the workings of a large supply chain enabler.

Major Responsibilities

  • Learn the key elements of railroading
  • Research technology trends in the railroad and adjacent industries then document how they would be applied
  • Prepare technical radars and reports for specific innovation topics
  • Assess potential suppliers on their product and service offering, including both start-ups and market leaders
  • Support the delivery of proof of concept and prototyping initiatives, including business cases, data gathering, and delivery planning
  • Develop and execute innovative communication strategies for digital tools such as Yammer and SharePoint
  • Create standard templates for research requests
  • Shadow meetings with research partners and suppliers

Requirements

  • Shows initiative and empowers others
  • Identifies opportunities
  • Solves problems using analytical thinking
  • Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience
  • Collaborates with others
  • Deals with pressure and change by staying calm to quickly adapt to changes
  • Knowledge of Scientific written communication and technology principles
  • Knowledge of AI, Machine Learning, Internet of Things (IoT), Big Data, Computer Vision, advanced analytics, automation, and positioning technologies
  • Knowledge of technologies and practices such as Optimizers, Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAVs), wearables, extended reality, Blockchain, autonomous vehicles, digital twins, edge computing, control towers, data governance, and railroad operations*
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
  • Knowledge of Teams and SharePoint

Education

  • Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or Business

*Any experience/education/skills/knowledge for these above would be considered as an asset

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer (very flexible on the years of experience)
description:
RBCers across Technology & Operations, Chief Data Office, and Personal and Commercial Banking will present their team’s mandates and priorities as well as any current and upcoming roles at the RBC Information Session(Hybrid). Networking and speed interviews will follow team presentations.

Please Note: Applicants without those years of experience are encouraged to apply. RBC is very flexible on the amount of experience they are looking for in this role and looking forward to meeting you in person if you are available.

Due to capacity and space limitations, RBC encourages Vector’s upcoming grads and alumni to attend the session in person and looks forward to meeting all others virtually.

Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Full Stack Engineer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

What if you could use your technology skills to work on products that make an impact when it comes to delivering unforgettable client experiences? Our team is building capabilities that enable the end-to-end transformation of our customers' journeys –building and leading with technologies that put data privacy and responsible AI practices at the forefront. We’re a team of resilient, collaborative people with a hunger for learning and delivering trusted data and AI-powered capabilities to support top-notch client experiences and we have our sights set on building the tech stack of the future with modern, flexible architecture by building once, and reusing across channels – how’s that for efficiency?

We’re building a team who is not afraid to challenge the status quo, embraces innovation, and is excited to bring a fresh perspective. We’re looking for a talented and passionate Lead Engineer to join our team in Toronto. People who join our team will be able to work on the most innovative solutions to enable self-service analytics capabilities delivered via both public and private cloud platforms using event and microservices-based architectures. Join our team today and magnify your impact influencing the future of banking on a global scale. RBC is committed to being the destination of choice for technologists, driven by our engineering culture of curiosity, bold ambition and outcomes

What will you do?

As the Lead Full Stack Engineer, you will play a key role in our immediate and long-term strategic technical delivery direction for a multi-disciplined team of technologists. Nurturing culture and facilitating learning and knowledge sharing will be second nature to you as well as applying your technical know-how to ensure that the team is on the leading edge of technical delivery practices. You’ll have the tools and support needed to achieve extraordinary results that render a significant impact extending beyond the boundaries of traditional technology roles. Ideas start here – and you will build great technology.

If you have a passion for delivering top-notch data and AI-driven services and applications and are passionate about data privacy, security and responsible AI related technologies - we have a spot for you on our team.

  • Design & execution of hybrid and multi-cloud application deployments of AI/ML-driven applications and data services that enable our trusted data and AI mission
  • Develop methodologies & frameworks for systematically validating the performance, security, and trustworthiness of deployed ML models
  • Apply design thinking and an agile mindset in working with other engineers, data scientists and business stakeholders to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on new initiatives
  • Actively engage with stakeholders to gather requirements and ideate software solutions and support creation of scalable software
  • Write clean, functional code for large-scale distributed applications
  • Test software (unit, system, integration and acceptance testing) to ensure responsiveness and efficiency and where required troubleshoot, provide solutions to fix / debug and upgrade software
  • Partner with and support other teams as required; there are many teams, yet we are one team.
  • Leverage best practices in continuous integration and delivery, with a strong commitment to quality
  • Explore new capabilities and technologies to drive innovation

Must-have

  • Experience (6+ years) working software delivery teams in mid to large software/IT organizations developing scalable, highly available and performant applications and microservices, participating in design sessions and code reviews with skills in the following areas:
    • Data Engineering & API Development: expertise in at least one major programming language (Java, Python, Scala etc.) and messaging technology (e.g., Kafka etc.)
    • Security frameworks: Kerberos, OAuth 2.0, Vault integration
    • Cloud and Containers: AWS, OpenShift, Docker, Pivotal Cloud Foundry
    • SQL/Data Stores: PostgreSQL, S3, HDFS, Elasticsearch, Redis etc.
    • DevOps: Git, Jira, Jenkins, Confluence etc.
  • A passion for simplifying and automating work, making things better, continuous learning, solving open-ended problems, improving efficiency and helping others
  • Strong communication skills with ability to work cross-functionally to articulate, measure and solve issues
  • Great attention to detail, organizational skills and an analytical mind

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Airflow, graph databases, Jupyter Notebooks, other ML-related technologies
  • IAPP CIPT Certified

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Opportunity to work on cool stuff and make a difference
  • Work in a fun, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Access to world-class learning resources and relevant programs
  • Flexible, hybrid work/life balance options

title: Senior Strategy Manager, Data Platforms
description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

The Enterprise Data Layer team designs, implements and oversees the GCP analytics platform at TELUS. Known as the DataHub, our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the organization with modern cloud native services, modern BI tools, DataOps methodologies and processes, and a self-serve data environment to test & learn and productionalize data models enabling data driven decisions. Our vision is to empower our TELUS business partners with a standardized platform utilizing infrastructure, policy and governance as code, setting guide rails for teams to develop their data & analytics use cases within our cloud data platform and BI toolsets.

We are looking for enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solutions enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform. You will support digital transformation at TELUS by partnering with teams across the organization to make better use of their data. Use your strong communication, critical thinking and change management experience to assess the impact of transformation on our partner teams, the upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS.

What you’ll do

  • Support the establishment of data a shared strategy across the enterprise to enable the business to meet its strategic and financial objectives
  • Support the creation of automated work intake process, prioritization, metrics, process improvements and resource alignment to planned roadmaps
  • Drive a governed approach with increasing maturity around our data & analytics platforms and tools
  • Liaise with our business and IT partners to ensure alignment on roadmaps and strategic initiatives delivering value and supporting a data driven culture
  • Lead annual strategy reviews for the Enterprise Data Platforms team and collaborate with owners in our larger business unit including coordination and material creation
  • Monitor trends, innovation and opportunities in the industry and with our Vendors
  • Support your DataOps team members in delivering the ideal cloud data architecture with a focus on self-serve, efficiency, security and privacy
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Support our internal web presence, knowledge portal, intake process, and “Quick Reference Guides” increasing customer awareness and standardization of data environments across TELUS
  • Author quality documentation and materials to support messaging around new data capabilities, services and analytics tools, roadmaps, customer onboarding to our data platform, roadmaps, change management and alignment across IT teams

Qualifications


What you bring

  • 5-7 years of experience in a Management Consulting, Digital agency or Corporate Strategy with a large organization
  • 3-5 years of experience working in Technology
  • Experience helping organizations evolve their way of working, defining and implementing new operating models and standing up Transformation efforts
  • You are an exceptional communicator that excels at compelling storytelling and presentations
  • You have good understanding of Data & Analytics principles and tools and digital transformation initiatives
  • You have experience managing business stakeholders and engaging with many diverse technical teams to aligning deliverables
  • You have a proven track record of engaging with technical leaders and SMEs to create quality roadmaps to be reviewed and accepted at a senior level within the organization
  • You are collaborative and able to work with various IT and business teams to deliver on outcomes
  • You are able to share a vision and implement long-term data strategies while providing value early and often along the journey
  • You can distill complex solutions and interactions to gain support and engagement with senior leaders and business stakeholders
  • You have experience working with IT vendors and corporate partners

Great-to-haves

  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform
  • Enterprise Architecture experience specifically in the data space
  • Experience with FinOps and Cloud platform budget management
  • University degree in Business, Information Technology Management or Engineering

title: Digital Strategy & Insights Analyst, Summer 2023 (Co-o/Internship) 4 months
description:
Address:

55 Bloor Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.

  • Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
  • Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
  • Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.
  • Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
  • Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.
  • Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences.
  • Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
  • Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives.
  • Completes complex & diverse tasks within given rules/limits and may include handling escalations from other employees.
  • Analyzes issues and determines next steps.
  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

    Qualifications:

  • Typically between 2 – 3 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study desirable or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS - Good.
  • Specialized knowledge.
  • Verbal & written communication skills - Good.
  • Organization skills - Good.
  • Collaboration & team skills - Good.
  • Analytical and problem solving skills - Good.

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

title: Data Scientist
description:
The Position

Role: Data Scientist

Type: FTE

Roche Data Scientists are essential leaders in driving and implementing a broad range of quantitative drug development strategies; they bring data to life and enable the organization to make the best possible data-driven decisions.


As a Data Scientist at Roche Pharma, you’ll actively shape the future of healthcare as a member of Data and Statistical Sciences (DSS) within Product Development (PD) and PD Data Sciences (PDD). You will be responsible for the strategic and analytical activities of the molecules and devices in our
pipeline on a level matching your seniority.


DSS activities span multiple therapeutic areas, a wide range of data types, and collaborations with a variety of experts, all with the goal to develop innovative healthcare solutions for patients and society.


Your responsibilities in support of our PDD products may include a wide variety of contributions: partnering with key stakeholders, working on the molecule portfolio, supporting specialized business areas, or contributing to key initiatives that shape our technical, business and healthcare environments. You may be a work product owner and leader, quantitative expert on a project team, or driver of key internal or external relationships.

- Delivers data analysis products such as data tabulations, analysis datasets, statistical tables/listings/figures, and interactive applications related to clinical trial data and analysis
- Supports study results reporting by producing these deliverables in collaboration with internal and external colleagues
- Provides analytical and programming expertise, and contributes to the production of programming packages and functions that can be used across studies and molecule programs
- Supports regulatory submissions to health authorities and contributes to data standardization in order to maximize reusability

Key Accountabilities

Data Sciences Leadership

- Accountable for the development and implementation of Data Sciences products.
- Lead and/ or support multiple elements of the drug development process across various phases of clinical trials.
- Lead and/ or support regular review of opportunities to simplify and innovate, and collaborate with experts in DSS, PDD and beyond to accelerate and deliver patient benefits faster.
- Lead and/ or support prioritization efforts, demonstrating urgency and taking smart risks to make considered decisions in a fast-paced, evolving environment.


Drug Development Strategy and Execution

- Lead or contribute technical expertise to multiple elements of the business, including: strategic planning; communication; and implementation.
- Support and/or represent DSS and PDD across multiple functions of the Roche global organization, which may include; Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED); Genentech Research and Early Development (gRED); PD; Market Access, Global Product Strategy (GPS); and Pharma Technical (PT).
- Purposefully collaborate and influence to support PDD to be at the forefront of our industry for Data Sciences.
- Collaborate with Global Health Authorities to support our product pipeline.
- Build strong partnerships and opportunities to collaborate and innovate with varying stakeholders across the Roche global organization in support of Roche products, programs, processes, systems, and/or compliance.


Career Development

- Continuously look for opportunities to broaden knowledge, capabilities and skill set to enable talent to flow into different Specialties and Disease Areas.
- Role model knowledge sharing within DSS, PDD, and beyond.
- Act as a coach, mentor, or buddy to help colleagues grow and develop.


Technical Accountability

- Contribute technical, therapeutic and business expertise within and external to DSS and PDD, which may include: Research and Development products; Drug development and clinical trial products; Current and new technologies; Working with external data and external organizations; Global Health Authority requirements; Data Sciences industry landscape; Statistical methods and techniques; Analytical strategies; Programming languages; Software development; Data standards; Therapeutic area expertise; Outsourcing expertise; Findable,
Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable (FAIR) Data Principles; Data Citizenship; Data Privacy; Best practices; and Process improvements, etc.
- Explore ways of modernizing insight generation through new innovative tools and technology.
- Build expertise in novel data types, statistical methods, programming languages, and analytical methodology, which may include advanced analytics, special trial designs and types, and data handling methods.
- Demonstrate a good level of system awareness.


Qualifications

Additional educational and technical qualifications may be added based upon the Specialty being recruited.
- College/University degree – bachelor degree or higher or equivalent education in scientific, medical or relevant technical discipline.
- Experience in the pharmaceutical/biotech industry is preferred.
- Understanding of the end-to-end drug development lifecycle, particularly as relevant to the Specialty of interest.
- Track record of establishing successful internal partnerships and collaborations.
- Influential and confident communicator
- Demonstrates experience or is adaptable to utilizing and/or models modern ways of working consistent with an agile and growth mindset, and agile behaviors and methodologies.
- Fluency in written and spoken English
- Ability to work across multiple cultures and countries
- Knowledge of GCP, international regulations, guidelines and their application, and all other applicable compliance standards is a plus
- Willingness to travel as required

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche Pharma Canada has its office in Mississauga, Ontario and employs over 850 employees. The Mississauga facility is bright, vibrant, fosters collaboration and teamwork, and is reflective of Roche\'s truly innovative culture.

As of January 4, 2022, Roche requires all new employees who work in Canada to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 on the date they take office. This requirement is a condition of employment at Roche that applies regardless of whether the position is on a Roche campus or remotely. If you have a valid reason for not being fully immunized, which is limited to certain specific medical reasons or other valid reasons protected by applicable human rights laws, you may request an exemption and / or adaptation measures regarding this vaccination requirement.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and execution of fraud detection strategies using advanced analytical methodologies and techniques. These fraud detection strategies will be applied with the goal of reducing RBC’s Fraud Risk and losses, while maintaining a positive client experience and controlling operating costs. You will innovate and implement novel methodologies to improve detection and efficiency across the team, further automating and streamlining processes. You will contribute to and support a variety of projects and initiatives across Fraud Management and collaborate with multiple stakeholders at varying levels of seniority.

Please Note: This position is not a people manager role and we welcome applicants from across Canada.

What will you do?

  • Implement advanced analytical methodologies and proactively identify opportunities to innovate new techniques for fraud detection strategy creation and process and technology improvements
  • Collaborate with Data Science & Innovation on machine learning and artificial intelligence projects that impact fraud detection, document methodology and standardize process to ensure repeatability
  • Develop, maintain and optimize fraud detection strategies for non-traditional channels & products, and explore multiple data sources to proactively identify emerging fraud trends and patterns
  • Leverage reporting to monitor the performance of existing fraud detection strategies, optimize these strategies and use analytical tools to improve detection strategies, enhancing the tools & techniques
  • Prioritize fraud detection alerts across detection platforms, verify that all rule deployments are accurate and ensure a balance between fraud losses, client experience and operational costs
  • Contribute to Fraud Management projects and initiatives, provide detection recommendations and implement detection strategies by project deadlines
  • Develop Fraud Detection analytics best practices, contribute to the development and implementation of the rule strategy framework and create programming code standards for fraud detection
  • Collaborate across the team to ensure best practices are applied, act as a technical resource for other team members and respond to inquiries regarding fraud data and detection strategies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ years’ experience in analytics or data science related roles, working with large, real-world datasets
  • Strong practical knowledge of, and proven experience with, analytical software packages and various programming languages (eg: SAS, R, SQL, Python etc.)
  • Strong critical thinking and analytical skills with the ability to solve complex problems and develop data-driven solutions
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills, including the ability to effectively communicate analytical recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Thought leadership capability to lead complex initiatives and discussions driven by analytical and business insights
  • Ability to see the big picture and guide groups with strategic thinking
  • Excellent time management skills and demonstrated ability to prioritize workload effectively
  • Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative discipline

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Scala or other big-data platform technology/tools
  • Knowledge of Canadian banking and payment industry payments transaction data and financial fraud

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Continued career advancement opportunities
  • Exposure to strong mentorship and leadership examples
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

title: Data Engineer Manager
location: Canada : Ontario : Mississauga || Canada : Ontario : North York
description:
Requisition ID: 173481

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose

Contributes to the overall success of Global Operations ensuring specific individual goals, plans and initiatives that are executed/delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Responsible for supporting the end-to-end reporting lifecycle. This includes sourcing the requisite data, delivering sound data solutions to enable reporting and supporting the infrastructure and product portfolio. Ensures all development initiatives are executed and delivered with high quality and in compliance with Enterprise Security and Audit requirements

Accountabilities

  • Champions a customer-focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
  • Designs and maintains scalable data architecture in SQL Server (on-premise and Azure) to support periodical integration, transformation, validation and analysis of financial/operational data sourced from diverse teams. Ensure data architecture is aligned with the Enterprise Technology and Data Roadmaps.
  • Work in an Agile environment, be quick to adapt and understand dynamic business requirements and be able to work with tight timelines. Proactively supports data-based decision-making across operational functions by identifying analytical prospects in operational/financial data.
  • Identify opportunities to automate processes/tasks that are manual and repetitive in nature, within the existing business process or operational process.
  • Follow iterative development principles to design, code, test, implement and support data and analytics solutions using industry best practices. Apply a consistent strategy to profile and model the data, setting a solid foundation for dashboards and ad hoc reporting.
  • Support product vision, scope and objectives based on a thorough understanding of the Business goals and requirements. Partner with source system owners across the Enterprise to acquire the necessary data to satisfy business objectives by creating data contracts and data dictionaries.
  • Skilled in XML, CSharp, Java, ASP.NET, MVC development. Responsible for developing and maintaining routines and developing UI design to load, access and extract data in Microsoft SQL Server Environment.
  • Provide sound data mining techniques and analytical methodologies to provide fact-based analysis to support data initiatives and improve business processes. Leverage agility and creativity to maximize value and insight delivered by data analysis.
  • Proactively recommend and execute strategies to improve methodology, operational efficiency and effectiveness, and quality of deliverables. Continually identify, propose, and assist in the integration and adoption of new technologies and methodologies as appropriate.
  • Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions. Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.

Dimensions

  • Proficient in XML, Java, CSharp and ASP.NET application development
  • Data visualizations for Power BI reporting
  • All business units in Global Operations
  • Number of projects: ongoing operational reporting initiatives for the Retail and Business Banking Operations, Contact Centre, Collections and Corporate Services

Qualifications

  • University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Analytics, Mathematics or related fields is required
  • 5+ years of practical experience is an asset
  • Advanced knowledge of Business Intelligence solutions, database design, data mining, profiling, and modelling techniques. Solid experience with SQL Server 2012/2016/2017, ETL, SSRS, SSAS, MDX, XML, Java, C# and ASP.NET, Unified Dimensional/Relational modelling
  • Experience integrating with Hadoop and working with Big Data technologies; Microsoft Visual Studio & Team Foundation Server is an asset
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI) is required

Working Conditions

  • Work in a standard office-based environment; non-standard hours are a common occurrence.

Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

title: Manager, Application Fraud Analytics
location: Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Ontario : North York
description:

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

As a Manager, Application Fraud Analytics, you will contribute to the overall success of the Fraud Management Group in Canada ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted follow governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.

title: Lead Ecosystem Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Lead Ecosystem Data Analytics Engineer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Senior Analytics Ecosystem Data Engineer will provide technical insight, hands-on development and data governance best practices for Internal Audit. This role is a leadership role targeted to increase the adoption of the IA Analytics Ecosystem and Data Products. This role also contributes to IA data strategy and best practices definition within area of Data Analytics, Data Management and Data Governance standards.

What will you do?

  • Partner with Audit Platform leads, data scientists, product managers and engineers to design, develop and deploy data solutions within the IA Ecosystem
  • Provide ongoing support for analytics processes in production on IA Ecosystem to promote operational safety and soundness and maintain end user satisfaction
  • Lead, Manage and Influence IA Ecosystem architecture capabilities and design decisions during the product development cycle to ensure technical development standards are being met and best practices are being followed
  • Active development within Data Engineering stack for a given initiative (UI, mid-tier, and back-end services) working on medium to high complexity solutions, frameworks and platforms
  • Work with large data sets, visualize end product and understand optimum processes to extract data and present in a solution which is understood and relevant to the business end user
  • Work with change management owners to identify change impact, risks, and mitigation strategies. Ensure that the approved plan is supported within the team, with stakeholders, and affected employees, and ensure that escalations are handled appropriately according to the approved plan
  • Strong collaboration and stake holder management; providing data and analytics solution advise to the audit business groups for relevant domain/portfolio

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 4+ years’ experience in backend development expertise using Python, ETL tooling (Dataiku, Datastage)
  • 4+ years’ experience in development with traditional database technology (i.e. SQL, Hadoop)
  • Strong experience with data visualization and reporting tools – e.g. Tableau
  • Strong expertise in Data Platforms, developing and managing data pipelines
  • Expertise with tools such as GitHub, as well as software development and change management processes to manage implementation of centralized code and software releases

Nice-to-have

  • 4-Year Undergraduate STEM degree (e.g. B.Com., B. Math, B.Sc, P. Eng.)
  • Experience in developing applications using JavaScript frameworks such as Vue, React or Angular.
  • Strong knowledge for creation of automated unit tests, integration, end-to-end testing and DevOps practices (E.g. CI/CD).

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits

  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization
  • This is a hybrid opportunity

title: Operations Modernization Analyst Intern/ Co-op
description:
Company Overview

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer.

Why TD?

TD’s Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.

A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That’s our unique and inclusive culture.

Department Overview

Ops Modernization supports the Canadian Personal Banking Operations team through the development, support and analysis of tactical solutions. We collaborate closely with business partners to deliver a legendary experience to the distribution teams and customers. The mandate is to deliver best in class service and advice while operating within the business’ credit risk appetite and regulatory framework.

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across several businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op/ Internship roles and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:
• Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
• Lunch & Learns on topics such as Innovation
• Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

Job Description

You will have the opportunity to work with the Ops Mod PITT Crew (Process Improvement Tools & Transformation) within the CPB Credit Operations group. From Day 1, you will be treated as an equal member of the team and given meaningful assignments to help us deliver improvements across our credit teams.

Job responsibilities may vary by area and may include, but is not limited to the following:

  • Supporting the development of business tools, process improvement and tactical business solutions to increase efficiency and reduce risks across the business lines that we support.
  • Determining operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.
  • Designing new computer programs by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications
  • Improving systems by studying current practices, designing modifications
  • Recommending controls by identifying problems, writing improved procedures
  • Defining project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget
  • Monitoring project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions
  • Maintaining system protocols by writing and updating procedures
  • Providing references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training users
  • Maintaining user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential
  • Preparing technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
  • Maintaining professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies
  • Contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed

Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree in Finance, Accounting, Analytics, Data, Business/Commerce or related field with the intent of going back to school at the start of your work term
  • Excellent communication skills, and ability to convey complex information concisely and with clarity
  • Highly developed critical thinking and ability to deliver actionable recommendations in a timely manner
  • Well organized, flexibility to adapt and manage within a fast-paced, dynamic business environment
  • Experience developing or designing tools, data queries or applications.
  • Java, JSON, VBA, SQL Coding knowledge and experience are an asset.
  • Proficiency in Excel, data querying, data processing, and visualization tools.
  • Proficiency in PowerPoint and developing clear and compelling business presentations.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to think strategically and synthesize information quickly.
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely (written and verbally) to a broad audience.
  • Ability to independently manage deadlines while multitasking between different projects.
  • High degree of numeracy, including experience with financial modeling/forecasting.
  • Experience working with large and discrete forms of data, and designing analytics with the objective of surfacing insights and providing recommendations.
  • Highly developed presentation and communication skills (verbal and written).
  • Ability to work in a team environment.

Additional Information

  • This position is a 4-month work term and will commence September 5th – December 22nd, 2023
  • Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages)
  • We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest
  • TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements
  • You must be enrolled at a college/university program to qualify for this Co-op/Internship opportunity

Start Date

– Fall

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Vice President, Data and Analytics Technology
description:
Requisition ID: 178107

We are committed to investing in our employees and helping you continue your career at Scotiabank.

Purpose

The Vice President, Data and Analytics Technology will be responsible for the delivery of data and analytics solutions globally, leading the direction and strategic alignment of reusable data and analytics at scale, and ensuring business strategies, plans, and initiatives are supported in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.

Accountabilities

  • Define and provide strategic guidance to Scotiabank’s technology and architecture supporting analytics.
  • Define and provide strategic guidance to Scotiabank’s technology and architecture supporting enterprise data platforms.
  • Develop and deliver data and analytics technology solutions globally, leveraging innovative and sustainable solutions.
  • Be a trusted advisor and key strategic influencer directly supporting Customer Insights Data & Analytics.
  • Enable advanced analytics, AI / machine learning, enterprise wide, to maximize business results.
  • Prioritize, develop, scale, and manage technology supporting enterprise data and analytics.
  • Influence key stakeholders within the data and analytics space, as well technology.
  • Have deep knowledge of key technologies supporting the Bank’s strategy, including but not limited to data and analytics.
  • Understand how the Bank’s systems work and how enhancements can create operational efficiencies.
  • Enable a culture that promotes critical thinking, change leadership, and sharing best practices.
  • Lead and drive a customer-focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.
  • Direct day-to-day activities in a manner consistent with the Bank’s risk culture and the relevant risk appetite statement and limits; communicate the Bank’s risk culture and risk appetite statement throughout their teams.
  • Create an environment in which his/her team pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
  • Build a high-performance environment and implement a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops, and motivates their team.
  • Foster an inclusive work environment; communicate vison/values/business strategy; manage succession and development planning for the team.

Education / Experience
  • Bachelors or higher degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Analytics, Finance and/or Artificial Intelligence.
  • Minimum 10 years of demonstrated experience leading technology delivery, preferably in Financial Services.
  • Experience working with Big Data, NoSQL, Hadoop, Hive, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, Public Cloud (Azure/GCP), or others; AI and machine learning preferred.
  • Experience integrating business and technology teams.

The Vice President, Data and Analytics Technology will exercise strategic influence over the Bank’s data and analytics design, governance, and associated processes, and requires the following:

  • Expert knowledge of the data and analytics industry, including trends, best practices, and methodologies.
  • Strong stakeholder management, ability to influence in a complex matrix environment and build relationships.
  • Deep knowledge of advanced analytics, AI, and machine learning; ability to deliver measurable results through data and analytics.
  • Strong ability to balance competing or conflicting goals of various departments / countries / stakeholders; highly developed negotiation and influencing skills.
  • Strong leadership and team building skills to create and sustain highly motivated groups within diverse and multi-functional reporting units.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Technology Architect - Responsible AI
description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

The TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customers\' privacy and to earn and maintain their trust. As the Technology Architect, Responsible AI, reporting to the Director of Data Ethics, you will work with a cross-functional group focused on enabling a framework for responsible use of artificial intelligence (Ai) and guide the development of AI, data-driven products and services in accordance with ethical principles.

You will be a champion for responsible AI across the organization and you will advocate for TELUS’ Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all of our decisions around data, recognizing how critical customer and team member trust is to TELUS’ mission. Your commitment to responsible AI will support our business needs as well as our position on social capitalism as we seek opportunities to innovate with data. This will help our business to implement AI solutions that not only perform well, but also operate ethically and responsibly, benefiting society as a whole.

What you’ll do

  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop and implement AI solutions in accordance with the TELUS’ Trust Model and data ethics framework
  • Advising on how responsible AI can serve as an enabler for business program operations and assist with the deployment of responsible AI across the organization
  • Developing and implementing testing and validation protocols to ensure AI systems are working as intended
  • Conducting research and staying up-to-date with the latest developments in AI ethics and responsible AI practices
  • Supporting the development of a TELUS’ framework for responsible AI in line with emerging leading practices
  • Integrating responsible AI into processes to support agile development methodology
  • Educating and advising business units on existing or new techniques, and providing innovative strategies and creative solutions to implement responsible AI
  • Participating in industry-wide efforts to advance responsible AI practices and standards

What you bring

  • Demonstrated track record of providing subject matter expertise embedding responsible AI into product and services while delivering on measurable outcomes in a highly complex stakeholder environment
  • Demonstrated working knowledge or understanding of responsible AI fundamentals (e.g. differential privacy, federated learning, adversarial testing, etc.) and machine learning pipelines
  • Familiarity with statistics, algorithms, and machine learning tools to analyze and evaluate fair and ethical AI, including generative AI
  • Passionate about responsible AI and the imperative to use data to solve big and small problems
  • Keen to explore new and creative solutions to change the trajectory of persistent challenges and motivated to bring those solutions to life
  • Appreciated for your excellent interpersonal and problem solving skills, and your ability to distill complex and/or ambiguous problems into clear, actionable requirements
  • Known for your ability to influence and negotiate effectively, to be a persuasive advocate, and known for your conflict resolution skills with a focus on win-win solutions
  • Sought out for excellent communication skills, verbal & written, with the ability to present information at all levels of the organization and leadership forums
  • 3-5 years experience in responsible AI
  • Post-secondary degree in computer science, computer engineering, information systems, ethics, or related field of study

Great-to-haves

  • Experience with the development, design, and architecture of IT technology, data management, and data integration processes
  • Experience with design for software applications running on multiple platforms
  • Experience with web architecture and the privacy and security model of the web
  • Bilingual in French & English, verbal and/or written
  • Certification in Privacy (e.g., CDPSE, CIPT, CIPM, CIPP certification)

Location: Any major Canadian city

DTOJOBS2023

title: Senior Analyst, Strategic Analytics, RBCx Ventures (Mydoh)
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Strategic Analytics, RBCx Ventures (Mydoh)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In the role of Senior Analyst, Strategic Analytics, you will be responsible for evolving Mydoh\'s data landscape; and developing business performance dashboards and assisting in developing strategies to identify opportunities solutions to support growth and transformation.

What will you do?

  • Establish credibility by quickly acquiring and demonstrating subject matter expertise and deep knowledge in Mydoh

  • Drive future state reporting and Advanced Analytics to enable a fact base strategy utilizing internal and external data and insight

  • Drive insight from Mydoh data and competitive landscape in terms of what the data is telling up and what we need to do accordingly

  • Evolve Mydoh data landscape by implementing core data capabilities to enable private banking growth strategy leveraging modern data architecture and technologies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 2+ years of relevant experience in an analytical function

  • Nimble with SQL for querying and joining large datasets and/or creating reports

  • Experience communicating analytics results back to business partners and/or C-level: handling objections, proven experience on influencing driving data-driven strategy is a big plus.

  • Demonstrates innate curiosity and an ability to develop innovative solutions

  • An eager listener and a team player who is comfortable forming cross functional relationships with our partners, has proven experience of forming and managing these relationships, and is passionate about developing peers, winning as a team, and providing constructive feedback where and when needed

Nice-to-have

  • Experience publishing reports/dashboards, and visualizations with Tableau is a big plus.

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, business analytics)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

title: Director, AML Analytics
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, AML Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As the Director, AML Analytics you are responsible for developing and maintaining sophisticated anti-money laundering (AML) models to detect and prevent financial crimes within our organization. This is transformational role that arises from two emerging trends in anti-financial crime programs: the propagation of data / analytics capabilities used to detect financial crime and the need to identify increasingly complex-organized money laundering operations. The Director, AML Analytics will work with AML Insight and Analytics, the AML Transformation Office and the AML Financial Intelligence Unit to build and deliver leading edge analytic detection and investigative capabilities.

What will you do?

  • Develop and maintain anti-money laundering (AML) models to detect financial crimes.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
  • Apply sophisticated modelling techniques, including graph and machine learning analytics, to develop and implement components of the AML Investigator of the Future platform.
  • Establish a development roadmap for network risk scoring (batch and dynamic) by defining the prevalent features that will be integrated into the monitoring program and used in the course of an investigation.
  • Conduct data exploration and cleansing to ensure high-quality data for model development and validation.
  • Identify opportunities to streamline or automate processes to promote efficient and effective use of resources.
  • Implement and optimize scoring algorithms, decision trees, rule-based systems, and anomaly detection techniques.
  • Monitor model performance, identify issues, and propose solutions for continuous improvement and accuracy.
  • Conduct thorough testing and documentation of developed models, adhering to regulatory compliance standards.
  • Stay up to date with industry best practices, emerging trends, and regulatory changes in AML and predicate offense detection.
  • Collaborate with Compliance and Risk teams to address AML-related issues and provide technical expertise.
  • Participate in model validation exercises, including stakeholder engagement, analysis, and reporting.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Experience with AML or fraud modeling and investigation environments that utilize detection / predictive models

  • Programming experience ideally using an object oriented programing language such as Java, Scala (ideally), R or Python.

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience leading a data science or analytics team

  • Agile development methodology

  • Statistical approaches and methods and their application on projects

  • Post-secondary education or equivalent.

Nice-to-have

  • Graduate degree (MBA or relevant subject matter area)

  • Data mapping, meaning of relational data and object orientation.

  • Understands projects needs and can translate into detection models and capabilities.

  • Model documentation, ideally AML model governance

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work
