If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Intern, Solution Engineering
description:
At CN, everydaybrings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environmentwhere you’re part of making sure ourbusiness is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We welcome students who share theirideas, perspectives and understanding of newtechnologies withour teams. In return, we provide the opportunity towork on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. Youwill be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture workingtogether as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because thework we do matters. Join us!

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern,Solution Engineering position in enter Montreal, QC for winter 2023 (January – April).

Job Summary

The Intern, Solutions Engineering is responsible for contributing to the delivery of customer solutions in collaboration with other members of the Customer and Intermodal Solutions and Innovation team who will act as coaches and mentors. The role’s path is determined based on interest and career aspiration in order for the position to be an opportunity to work in the chosen fields of interest and learn more about cutting edge cloud-based enterprise solutions and mission critical systems.

Major Responsibilities

  • Participate to solution architecture and design including defining and documenting the design of architecture of the solutions to be delivered
  • Participate in Application Program Interface (API) and µServices and databases design to meet business requirements
  • Participate in front-end layers design for both web and mobile
  • Contribute to code base for backend and frontend
  • Contribute to a code base for data transformation and enrichment
  • Document solutions and standards
  • Engage in the peer review process and pair programming
  • Automate testing and deployment with Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) pipelines
  • Write and execute test scripts in accordance to requirements specification

Requirements

  • Knowledge or interest in full stack polyglot development (e.g., Java, Python, Javascript, Typescript, NodeJS, Angular, NativeScript, and ReactNative)
  • Knowledge or interest in databases or related programs (e.g., Structured Query Language (SQL), NoSQL, Document, GraphQL, Search - PostgreSQL, and MongoDB)
  • Knowledge or interest in modeling complex systems and data including Unified Modeling Language (UML)
  • Knowledge or interest in DevOps (e.g., Azure DevOps, GitHub, GitLab)
  • Knowledge or interest in Test automation, Test-driven development (TDD), Behavior-driven development (BDD), Acceptance test–driven development (ATDD)
  • Knowledge or interest in µService/API architecture (e.g., SpringBoot/Spring Cloud/API Gateway/ApiGee, Anthos)
  • Knowledge or interest in Distributed Systems and Enterprise Messaging Architecture (e.g. Kafka, Message Queue)
  • Knowledge or interest of cloud platform Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
  • Knowledge or interest in functional testing, performance testing and test automation

Education

  • Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering

*Any experience/education/skills/knowledge for these above would be considered as an asset

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Data Analyst Intern/Co-op
description:
Campus Role Type

Internship/Co-Op and Summer Opportunities

Start Date

– Winter

Hours

37.5

Workplace Model

Hybrid

Department Overview

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles, and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:

  • Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
  • Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation
  • Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

Job Details

You will have the opportunity to work with one of our various teams within the DaaS group. From Day 1, you will be treated as an equal member of the team and given meaningful assignments to help us deliver improvements to our data platforms across multiple segments such as Core Banking, Business Banking, Insurance, Wealth, or Enterprise Platforms.

Job responsibilities for a junior Data Analyst may vary by area. This may include, but is not limited to the following:

  • Work with business and technology partners to define, develop and document detailed business, data and system requirements.
  • Participate as a member of agile pod team focused on developing new capabilities, including agile ceremonies.
  • Collaborate with data engineers, product owners, quality engineers and other stakeholders to deliver an end-to-end capability from concept to production-deployment.
  • Have performed data analysis, profiling, clean-up, data wrangling and validation as part of University assignments.
  • Based on data analysis, provide recommendations for data remediation, improvements.
  • Participate in program/ system research, analysis, detailed design and problem resolution.
  • Respond to user enquiries on data platform, in a timely manner.
  • Troubleshoot and determine root cause and resolution for application defects.
  • Apply Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Project Management Methodology (PMLC) to complete specific tasks for projects.
  • Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise and keep up-to-date with leading-edge technologies trends/developments.
  • Develop expertise in data platform, infrastructure, data pipeline, analytical tools and design techniques that can contribute to effective solution development and delivery.
  • Good communication, interpersonal, collaboration skills to work in an agile cross-functional team, with different stakeholders.
  • Have owned, delivered a project assignment in University starting from Inception, Initiation, Execution until Implementation. Project outcome reviewed and measured as expected.

Job Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a relevant technology programs, such as Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology Management, Financial Analysis and Risk Management, Computing, etc.
  • Strong communication and inter-personal skills with the ability to deliver message and ideas effectively to diverse audiences such as business, development, quality engineers and management stakeholders.
  • A thirst for constantly exploring emerging technology such as Azure, python, Talend, Tableau, Informatica.
  • Familiarity with Jira and Confluence.
  • Proficient with Excel, Visio, SQL, some reporting and analytical tools.
  • Understands Data Modeling concepts.
  • Able to manage multiple priorities and work independently, as well as part of a team.
  • Experience with technology project delivery and agile delivery methodology would be an asset.
  • Some prior experience with creating visualization such as Process and Data Flows.
  • Good documentation skill; can produce data mapping between Source and Target Systems. Capture User Stories and Use Cases.
  • Hands-on programming experience would be an asset, which could include familiarity and strength in any of the following: C, C++, C#, Object C, Java, Java Script, Python, NodeJS, SQL, J2EE, Web Services, DB2, MS SQL.

Additional Information

Please note that this is a general posting. If you are selected for an interview, more information regarding which business group and the specific job duties will be provided.

Early Talent Requirements

  • This position is a 4-month work term and will commence January 8th – April 26th, 2024..
  • Applications must include a resume (maximum of 2 pages).
  • We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.
  • TD requires employees to reside in Canada where the role is located. Successful candidates are expected to arrange relocation to one of our Toronto offices in a hybrid model (1-3 days per week in office).

Assigned Line of Business Requirements
Please note that the line of business that you are assigned to may require specific skills not mentioned in this posting

HOURS
Monday-Friday, standard business hours

#P&T

Company Overview

Our Values
At TD we’re guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars — physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes … because when colleagues feel their best, they’re more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they’ll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world’s leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Inclusiveness

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We’re Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Associate Director, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As part of the Environmental & Social Risk Analytics team within Group Risk Management, you will play a role in the management, monitoring, and mitigation of environmental and social (E&S) risks at RBC. You will support and lead the design and implementation of key climate and E&S risk initiatives by providing research and data analytics and insights.

A significant focus of this role will be the calculation of RBC’s financed emissions across different asset classes within carbon-intensive sectors and setting and tracking progress on net-zero targets.

What will you do?

  • Work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to assist in the advancement of RBC’s capabilities in measuring financed emissions, setting net-zero targets, and delivering carbon accounting insights across the enterprise.
  • Support target setting through economic and industry research, making powerpoint slides and reports, and presenting research to a wide range of internal stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with diverse internal stakeholders across business lines and functions to share E&S Risk data and insights, to inform risk management, business strategy, and ESG and climate disclosures.
  • Identify opportunities to improve environmental & social risk data processes and take a leading role in implementing these changes;
  • Optimize data quality and results by seeking out public and private data sources and working with internal stakeholders to source RBC data to improve our climate risk measurement and management capabilities.
  • Lead workstreams and collaborations across multiple teams to accomplish the above
  • Contribute to the development and management of junior members of the E&S Risk Analytics teams

Must have

  • An interest in Environmental and Social Risk in general and climate change in particular
  • Experience in working in an analytics team, especially those tasked with solving difficult and/or vaguely-defined problems
  • The ability to synthesize data into business insights and communicate these clearly to diverse audiences
  • An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages, including SQL and python OR a proven ability to both code in another data analytics language (e.g. R, MATLAB, SAS) and the ability learn a new language quickly
  • Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for senior executives and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities
  • Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights
  • A desire and proven ability to build new and innovative approaches to complex problems with minimal direction
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Nice to have

  • Knowledge of climate change science with experience in the development and use of climate and economic scenarios, models, projections and data.
  • Knowledge or familiarity with the climate risk and/or target setting guidance issued by PCAF, NZBA, TCFD, ISSB, and/or OSFI (B-15)
  • Knowledge or familiarity with internal RBC wholesale lending data systems
  • Experience with or knowledge of carbon-intensive sectors, e.g. agriculture; aluminum; cement; coal; commercial and residential real estate; iron and steel; oil and gas; power generation; and transportation
  • Knowledge and experience in quantitative model development, testing and validation.
  • Experience working with a diverse range of stakeholders.
  • People manager experience

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
  • Opportunities to building close relationships

Job Summary

This position will support the advancement of the bank’s Environmental and Social Risk data management, analysis and disclosure capabilities, and the integration of this data into our risk management framework.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-09-14

Application Deadline:

2023-09-30

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

title: Senior Manager, Data Ethics Governance and Operations
description:
Requisition ID: 183978

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:


The Customer Insights Data and Analytics (CID&A) team at Scotiabank is at the forefront of the journey to transform the Bank into a data centric organization through impactful customer insights, innovative analytics, and well-governed data. One of the main areas of transformation is the way data is used, shared, and accessed at an enterprise level. The aim is to provide transparent, robust, and ethical data practices across the enterprise to enhance the protection of our customers’ data, and the way we deliver business value. We are looking to build our delivery team with influencers, makers, creators, and industry leaders who will drive us forward.
The role of the Senior Manager, Data Ethics Governance and Operations will be responsible for:

  • Enabling the Bank’s adoption of the Data Ethics Framework with a Global scope
  • Leading definition and implementation of industry leading data ethics practices and processes
  • Supporting, facilitating, and monitoring the organization’s efforts to adhere to the Data Ethics Framework
  • Setting up the day-to-day operations of the team (e.g., reporting, metric/KPI/Audit tracking,).


We are looking for someone who will make key contributions in developing, planning, and executing the adoption of processes and tools that enable ethical data use, third party data sharing frameworks, and streamlining data access rights. This role will work closely with our legal, privacy, data office, analytics, and technology teams in the bank to design and develop the processes for the ethical use of data.

Accountabilities:

  • Implement the operating model including standards, guidelines, and frameworks to enable ethical data use
  • Work closely with representatives across the bank to ensure activities are conducted in compliance with internal policies & procedures and emerging governing regulations
  • Works in cross-functional teams, providing guidance on data ethics standards and guideline
  • Participate in discussions focused on design and implementation of best practices and tools to support Data Ethics processes
  • Oversee the review process for: Data Ethics assessments (to provide ethical guidance for analytics, including AI and ML) and Sensitive Data reviews (to determine the level of protection required for data that is moving within the bank, including in cloud technology)
  • Ensures business stakeholder understanding, alignment and commitment to the objectives of the data ethics framework
  • Review the business stakeholders’ implementation of the data ethics framework for quality assurance and compliance
  • Ensure remediation and closure of audit issues within the stipulated deadline
  • Builds strategic relationships across the organization with counterparts in Risk, Compliance, Legal and other control functions to ensure consistency and alignment on best practices across the organization
  • Participate in planning and retrospective sessions, attend stand-ups, etc. – we work in an agile environment
  • Stay abreast of emerging ethical trends and ensure activities are always delivered with a best practice and innovation approach, reflecting appropriate technological developments for competitive business position
  • Lead a high-performance team – this is a people manager role


Requirements & Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in business/financial services
  • Knowledge and understanding of data governance, data policy, privacy
  • Ability to present ideas and facilitate discussions to build consensus at all levels.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and spoken
  • Ability to drive success in a high performing, flexible and small team environment
  • Strong analytical and communication skills and an ability to communicate and convey technical concepts into “layman terms”
  • Results orientation and pragmatic approach to decision making
  • Self-motivated, solution driven individual and adaptable to a fast-paced environment

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Velocity - Data Engineer Internship/Co-Op - Winter 2024
description:
Requisition ID: 184429

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: January 2024 - April 2024
Application Deadline: October 2nd, 2023

There's no better way to find your dream job than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

The Velocity Program is not your average internship or co-op! This is a customized experience that focuses on providing you with the development and tools you need to grow your career. After successfully completing a co-op or internship with top performance, we will work with you to establish your future placements. As a result, you will get to learn, grow, and experiment within different areas of both Scotiabank and Tangerine!

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Perform data exploration on different data sources and model training
  • Productionalize/Operationalize advanced analytics models following the Bank standards. ModelOps plays a key role as a liaison with other teams (Security, Privacy, Data Office, Analytics, Technology, among others)
  • Automate data pipelines and trigger actions/events to streamline business processes and models enablement
  • Enable mechanisms for Data Scientist and stakeholders to monitor the performance of a Model
  • Monitor the run time of the models, work closely with Data Scientist on continuous optimization
  • Monitor data pipelines, liaise with vendors, and source systems groups in the event of failures/maintenance
  • Migrate data pipelines and models to new analytics platforms
  • Experiment & learn!

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
  • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and hackathons.
  • You have knowledge/experience in:
  • Big Data Technologies (Hive/Beeline, HDFS, Sqoop, Spark)
  • Cloud platforms – GCP, Azure or AWS
  • MinIO Data Storage, Airflow, Trino
  • DB2, SQL Server
  • Python (PyHive, PySpark), R, SQL-Shell (Bash, Korn) & general Linux/Unix
  • CI/CD tech stack (BitBucket, Jenkins, Artifactory)

What’s in it for you?

  • You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
  • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
  • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.

How do I apply?

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you’re interested in to uncover your true potential. Instead, we ask that as part of your application you complete the below:

  1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
  2. Complete a short one-way video interview here.
  3. Complete a coding test through Codility to showcase your technical skills by solving job-related problems. Please make sure to have this Codility test completed prior to applying through our career site. When you're ready click here to begin the assessment.
  4. Once you have completed your Plum Profile and one-way video interview, apply to the role. Reminder: when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile!

Note: The one-way video interview, Plum, and Codility assessment for all our Velocity Technology Winter 2024 Internship applications are the same. You only need to complete this once!

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

title: Manager, Data Engineer
location: Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Ontario : North York
description:
Requisition ID: 185598

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose

Contributes to the overall success of the Global Operations Analytics department ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Responsible for supporting the end-to-end development and reporting lifecycle.

This includes sourcing the requisite data, delivering sound data solutions to enable reporting, and supporting the infrastructure/product portfolio. Ensures all activities conducted follow governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures

Accountabilities

  • Champions a customer-focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.
  • Designs and maintains scalable data architecture in SQL Server (on-premise and Private Cloud) to support periodical integration, transformation, validation and analysis of financial/operational data from diverse sources. Ensures data architecture is maintained consistently with data management principles and continuously evolves in alignment with the strategic technology and governance standard
  • Work in an Agile environment, be quick to adapt and understand dynamic business requirements, and be able to work with tight timelines. Proactively supports data-based decision making across operational functions by identifying analytical prospects in operational/financial data.
  • Identify opportunities to automate business tasks that are manual/repetitive in nature and drives continuous improvement to key processes. Continuously cycles through the review and application of techniques, tools, and/or utilities to promote working standards and maintain high-quality solutions.
  • Executes all development phases supporting the end-to-end delivery of data solutions. Proficiently performs activities which include data profiling, acquisition, modeling, cleansing & conforming, augmentation with reference data, aggregation, and visualization; setting a solid foundation for on-line interactive dashboards and ad hoc reporting

  • Maintains availability, reliability, and integrity of data products by developing and/or configuring appropriate information controls. Builds strong relationships with enterprise architecture, infrastructure and technology teams to ensure that performance commitments to support business partners are fulfilled.

  • Executes data mining techniques to provide fact-based analysis to support data initiatives and improve business processes. Leverage agility and creativity to maximize value added by data analysis.

  • Proactively recommend and execute strategies to improve methodology, operational efficiency and effectiveness, and quality of deliverables. Continually identify, propose, and assist in the integration and adoption of new technologies and methodologies as appropriate.

  • Understands how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions. Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of the respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.

Dimensions

  • Data visualizations for Power BI reporting
  • Scope: Canadian Operations
  • Number of projects: ongoing complex reporting initiatives for the Canadian Business/Retail Service Centres
  • MS Azure Cloud Services implementation

Qualifications

  • University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Analytics, Mathematics, or related fields is required
  • University degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or related fields
  • 7+ years of practical experience in business intelligence and data analytics is required
  • Advanced knowledge of database design, data mining, profiling and modelling techniques.
  • Solid experience with SQL Server, PEGA systems, developing Reporting Services (SSRS), building cubes using Analysis Services (SSAS), Dimensional/Relational modelling, and ETL
  • Experience integrating with Hadoop and working with Big Data technologies; Microsoft Visual Studio & Team Foundation Server
  • Experience with MS Azure Cloud Services (Implementation & Development)
  • Basic knowledge of Power BI and DAX coding
  • Experience with Python data libraries is an asset
  • Good communication skills are an asset
  • Familiarity of Commercial Banking products, services, policies and procedures, banking regulations and related regulatory requirements is an asset

Working Conditions

  • Work in a standard office-based environment; non-standard hours are a common occurrence.

title: Global Banking and Markets - COO Analyst - Summer 2024 - 12 month Intern/Co-op
description:
Requisition ID: 184249

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: May 2024 – April 2025

Application Deadline: 10/02/2023

There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

Global Banking and Markets (GBM) provides corporate and institutional clients with lending and transaction services, investment banking, advice, and access to capital markets. GBM is a full-service wholesale bank in the Americas, with operations in 21 countries, serving clients across Canada, the United States, Latin America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific.

Client Insights and Analytics is part of the COO (Chief Operating Officer’s) office in Global Banking and Markets. Our mandate is to lead the execution of our business strategies through powerful reporting and analytics. We are closely integrated with our business partners to drive adoption, and client strategies/insights and opportunities.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Work with our relationship managers for business lines including Corporate & Investment Banking, Capital Markets, Global Business Payments and International Corporate and Commercial Banking.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Please note: Invision AI is one of our participating employers in the upcoming Talent Meetup with Startups and Scaleups event hosted in a hybrid capacity on May 17, 2023, from 12.00-2.00 PM. Attending employers looking to meet and interview a captive audience of AI professionals who are actively seeking new opportunities now or by Fall 2023. For event registration, click here

About Us
Our mission is to see and understand the world. Invision AI offers deep expertise with respect to Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems in the intelligent infrastructure and transportation space.

We go beyond simple 2D detection by capturing details about the space in 3D, including volume, direction, position and speed. That enables us to provide high integrity 3D digital twins for real-time actionable insights across a variety of applications and use cases in both mobile (moving sensor suites on vehicles) and fixed (wayside) scenarios. We are the only company in the world that we know of that is able to track objects that move between different cameras to provide a full end-to-end view of a space.

We are looking for a motivated and skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in Toronto.

  • Deep knowledge and experience with Machine Learning algorithms, especially for object detection and classification. Experience in object tracking is a plus.
  • Good coder in Python; willing to go through rigorous code reviews
  • Clear and concise communicator
  • Find solutions that are pragmatic; realize that cutting-edge methods from literature are risky in terms of how well they work and often not necessary to complete a task

Job Description:

You will be in charge of the following tasks:

  • Design and implement solutions in python; verify and test, go through MR process
  • Review other people’s code and give feedback
  • Participate in daily standup and other team meetings
  • Analyze model inputs and outputs; fix bugs and suggest where and how our solution can be improved
  • Occasionally annotate data - Design and implement solutions in python; verify and test, go through MR process
  • Review other people’s code and give feedback
  • Participate in daily standup and other team meetings
  • Analyze model inputs and outputs; fix bugs and suggest where and how our solution can be improved
  • Occasionally annotate data

Invision AI offers deep expertise with respect to Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems in the intelligent infrastructure and transportation space. We have developed a number of unique technical innovations incorporated into a central AI platform. We go beyond simple 2D detection by capturing details about the space in 3D, including volume, direction, position and speed. That enables us to provide high integrity 3D digital twins for real-time actionable insights across a variety of applications and use cases in both mobile (moving sensor suites on vehicles) and fixed (wayside) scenarios. We are the only company in the world that we know of that is able to track objects that move between different cameras to provide a full end-to-end view of a space.

As a company, we distinguish ourselves by taking an integrated hardware-software approach throughout all our products as we constantly iterate between sensors (cameras, LiDAR, radar), their geometries and the associated vision and artificial intelligence algorithms. This has consistently allowed us to achieve industry-leading accuracy and reliability. We build lightweight, cost-effective, edge solutions: we locate compute nodes close to the sensors (as opposed to in the cloud) and leverage distributed compute and wireless transmission where needed.

We enjoy finding principled and practical solutions that mix computer vision, machine learning and software engineering.

title: Data Steward I
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

The TD Securities Chief Data Office (TDS-CDO) aims to operate, organize, govern and monetize TDS data assets. This is achieved through four strategic pillars:

  • Make Data Accessible
  • Secure & Govern Data
  • Create Tools & Enable Others to Use Them
  • Derive Value from Data

In doing so, the TDS-CDO enables the dealer with a focus on:

  • Grow: Service clients, monetize data & allocate resources
  • Protect: Manage Risk & Regulatory Compliance
  • Standardize: Achieve technology & operational efficiencies
  • Develop: Data Driven Culture

Job Description

About this Role

Reporting to the AVP, Data Governance in the Chief Data Office, the Data Steward I will be responsible to support the implementation of data governance and related data management activities for TD Securities.

Job Accountabilities:

  • Support the TDS-CDO in accordance with the Enterprise Data Policy, Standards and Strategy
  • Provides data governance expertise and executes data governance activities
  • Contribute to various operational activities and processes as assigned
  • Be knowledgeable of data management practices and procedures within own area of responsibility and keep abreast of emerging trends for own functional area
  • Assist and help drive the automation of the Data management practices including metadata, data lineage, authoritative sources, data usage, data quality rules, etc.
  • Be knowledgeable of data management tools related to metadata, lineage, data quality, etc. (e.g.: Collibra, Alation, Informatica, Ataccama, etc.)
  • Advises and consults with projects related to implementation of data management practices during system development (data impact analysis, quality controls, data lineage, etc.)
  • Develop and/or prepare applicable business metrics / standard / ad hoc reporting in collaboration with partners and stakeholders for data governance/management area to help inform or support decisions as appropriate
  • Conduct internal and external research projects; support the development / delivery of presentations / communications to management or broader audience
  • Conduct reporting and / or meaningful analysis at the functional or enterprise level using results to draw conclusions, make recommendations, assess the effectiveness of programs/ policies /
  • Support the development of presentations /communications and dissemination of information
  • Coordinate relevant processes /meetings /events that impact the TDS-CDO’s practices
  • Understand department objectives and contribute by recommending appropriate action to management based on analysis and review of results within assigned scope
  • Monitor service, productivity and assess efficiency levels within own function and implement continuous process / performance improvements where opportunities exist
  • Acquire and apply expertise in the discipline, provide guidance, assistance and direction to others
  • Adhere to internal policies/procedures and applicable regulatory guidelines
  • Keep abreast of emerging issues, trends, and evolving regulatory requirements and assess potential impacts
  • Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes in alignment with risk appetite
  • Consistently exercise discretion in managing correspondence, information and all matters of confidentiality; escalate issues where appropriate

Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

Education/Accreditations:

  • Undergraduate degree or technical certificate and/or
  • 5+ years relevant experience

Other Qualifications/Skills/Experience:

  • Solid knowledge of data governance/data management practices, enterprise data policy, standards &strategy
  • Solid knowledge of LOB data strategy, data risk management, and data life cycle management
  • Knowledge of current and emerging competitor and market trends
  • Skill in using analytical software tools, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
  • Skill in using computer applications including MS Office
  • Ability to communicate effectively in both oral and written form
  • Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships
  • Ability to work successfully as a member of a team and independently
  • Ability to exercise sound judgement in making decisions
  • Ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
  • Ability to handle confidential information with discretion
  • Knowledge of Basel Data Management Framework is desirable

Additional Information

#LI-Hybrid #LI-Post

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Manager, Data Engineering (MDM)
description:
Description

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Manager, MDM & Business Operations Insights. Reporting to the Director – Enterprise Data Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps of the enterprise data engineering team. The portfolio will focus specifically on the Master Data Management (MDM) workstream while also driving continuous improvement to our GCP engineering practices (common ingestion framework), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, SRE, batch and real-time data ingestion, and addressing technical debt. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission of driving value for TELUS via data enablement.

What you’ll do

At TELUS, we put ‘Customers First’. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:

  • Lead a team of talented data Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
  • Provide guidance to establish standards and best practices for building enterprise grade data pipelines
  • Work with our preferred Cloud service providers to align our roadmap based on their release schedule for services and product offerings
  • Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
  • Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
  • Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
  • Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
  • Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
  • Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team of data professionals

Qualifications

What you bring

  • You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction
  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
  • You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
  • You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
  • You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
  • You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
  • You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
  • You are flexible, adaptable and embrace ongoing change
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units
  • You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hive, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam), Kafka, MDM, IICS & PowerCentre ETL
  • You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectiveness

Great-to-haves

  • Bachelor of Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
  • PMP certification is an asset
  • Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in the telecommunications industry
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team

title: Senior Analytics Consultant
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Sr Data Analytics Consultant, Group Disability

Reporting to the Assistant Vice President, Group Disability Western Canada and National Mental Health Solutions, the Senior Analytics Consultant will lead the development of innovative analytics solutions including transformation processes and complex data models that form the core of a new generation of analytics services and self-serve solutions for Group Disability Operations and our clients.

Our growing mandate to deliver Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence and Data Solutions requires an experienced data consultant to accelerate the development of our strategic analytics projects in support of our Group Disability stakeholders.

What will you do?

  • Work directly with Group Disability operations leaders, consultants and clinicians; Group Benefits Market Development, along with data engineers, business data analysts, and data scientists in Canadian Operations throughout the entire engagement life cycle including technical analysis, design, development, implementation and consulting efforts
  • Maintain best practice standards for analysis and reporting at all levels including data governance, documentation, testing and visualization techniques
  • Lead and drive data modelling and analysis related to disability claims experience in support of Group Disability and related projects including setting up data for test and learn initiatives for research and development of innovation in disability management
  • Lead consultants in the team on various analytics projects
  • Facilitate group meetings of various sizes for solution design, decision making, problem-solving and solution implementation.
  • Turn complex data into easy to understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectives
  • Enable visual storytelling through Tableau and visual analytics tools
  • Coach and grow new and interested community of developers and champions within the organization

What will you need to succeed?

Education and Experience:

  • Minimum undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
  • 3-5 years of experience in:
  • SQL and other languages used in data manipulation
  • Tableau or other BI development experience and designing dashboards / decision enablement tools
  • Experience leading analytics projects with stakeholders
  • Data warehousing principles and experience in design and/or development using dimensional modeling principles
  • Good Understanding of ELT/ETL processes and Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services or equivalent technologies
  • Strong oral and written communication skills with experience in relating complex concepts to non-technical users, including presentation and storytelling with data
  • Visual design expertise with a solid understand of the best practices around dashboard and visual perception.
  • End-to-End development experience and ability to create complex calculations including Level of Detail (LOD) expressions, action filters, user filters and implement advanced dashboard practices in Tableau
  • Solid understanding of how to consolidate and transform data to meaningful and actionable information
  • Ability to draw out meaningful business insights by synthesizing information from multiple sources
  • Demonstrated experience in development of analytics applications or data analysis, including insights development and communication to senior leadership

What will be good to have?

  • Experience with AWS Data Lake
  • Experience with R, Python, AWS Sage Maker
  • Experience with Agile or design-driven development of analytics applications
  • PMP and/or Scrum Master certification
  • Experience with optimization and tuning of large data extracts for Tableau
  • Tableau desktop and server certification
  • Knowledge of Insurance or Financial Services industry

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
  • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program
  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family
  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

74,100/74 100 - 120,800/120 800

Job Category:

Advanced Analytics

Posting End Date:

18/05/2023

title: Velocity - Data Scientist Internship/Co-Op - Fall 2023
description:

Term: September - December 2023

As a result, you will get to learn, grow, and experiment within different areas of both Scotiabank and Tangerine!

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Collaborate with business lines and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to drive business value by leveraging data science solutions
  • Leverage distributed computing tools (e.g., Spark, Cloud) for analysis, data mining, and modeling
  • Collaborate with data engineering, software developer, and other analytics teams to build analytical dataset and model
  • Create and apply model and algorithm testing strategies to measure, conduct testing to measure the effectiveness of models, and make ongoing changes
  • Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models, and algorithms used and developed
  • Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes
  • Work on challenging and research-based initiatives using advanced machine learning methods focusing on data-driven outcomes
  • Experiment & learn!

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
  • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and hackathons.
  • You have knowledge/experience in:
  • Cleaning, transforming, and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g., unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files)
  • Big Data/Cloud ecosystem (e.g., GCP)
  • Experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning
  • Python programming
  • Common machine learning libraries in Python, PySpark (scikit-learn, xgboost)
  • UNIX tools and shell scripting
  • SQL skills for querying relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, DB2, MySQL)
  • Visualization tools like PowerBI
  • Kubernetes
  • Git Workflows (Pull Request, Code Review, Branching)

What’s in it for you?

  • You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
  • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
  • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.

How do I apply?

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you’re interested in to uncover your true potential. Instead, we ask that as part of your application you complete the below:

  1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
  2. Complete a short one-way video interview here.
  3. Once you have completed your Plum Profile and one-way video interview, apply to the role. Reminder: when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile!

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior Analyst, Reporting & Insights
description:
Requisition ID: 178001

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Contributes to the overall success of the Omni Channel Development team, taking effective ownership of developing data integration strategies, and creating various reporting streams that generate value-added actionable insights informing Retail Banking business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

The Sr. Analyst, Reporting & Insights, will play a key role in supporting the expansion of our reporting framework, improving our analytical processes, and sharing insights to multiple stakeholders and will be responsible for delivering value-added analytics aimed at creating sustainable business growth focusing on reporting, Insights and data visualization.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

• Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge

• Design and create reports, using data to analyze and improve our understanding of branch staff and customer behaviours, and monitoring the impact of strategic decisions and initiatives

  • Design and develop new reports to support management including but not limited to - visualization tools such as Tableau & PowerBI, complex data and logic tools, SAS, SQL, and self-service dashboards
  • Analyze data and evaluate results, identify emerging business issues, and prepare strategic recommendations for management
  • Continuously acquire and enhance knowledge of business/product strategies, portfolio management principles, branch processes and procedures, regulatory requirements, and advanced analytical tools/methodologies in order to best provide business solutions
  • Validating data extraction to ensure accuracy and accountability of reporting and insights.

• Automate any recurring reports and visualizations to support key areas of the business

• Support the Senior Manager in the development, execution and management of reporting suites

• Lead the automation of reports on an ongoing basis to increase productivity, efficiency and accuracy of analysis
• Synthesize multiple data sources and research insights that capture human insights, convey ideas, and provoke new growth opportunities

• Present research insights that are actionable, compelling, and connected to the business strategy
• Partner with broader team members as subject matter expert to support enterprise business program priorities and strategic objectives
• Perform automation of data extraction, transformation and reporting processes to increase efficiencies

• Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions

• Actively pursue effective and efficient operations of their respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk

• Champion a high performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:

• University degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Business Management or a related discipline
• Advanced SAS and/or SQL experience. Python/R are also preferred
• Expertise in data visualization tools such as Power BI
• Excellent mathematical, analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to interpret complex data, and be able to conclude meaningful insights. Curious and passionate about data, data visualization and introducing automation
• Excellent business acumen and strategic thinking skills
• Excellent communication and presentation skill (written and verbal) is essential
• Understanding of Canadian retail banking
• Ability to work well both independently and with teams also a Self-starter and must be comfortable working in an environment with tight deadlines and multiple priorities. Collaborative team player, Flexible, motivated, and results oriented

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.
